Reviews.Title: “Great ambiance, Excellent Staff and fine location”
Reviews.Author: Rhoda R
Reviews.Content: I made a last minute reservation with ths hotel on my first visit to Istanbul and I was very happy with it. I found it to be a gift from God. Its location is close to all the tourist attractions. The staff in the hotel will go the extra mile to make guests at home. Breakfast is always plentyful and delicious. I would recommend anyone exploring Istanbul to stay here and enjoy its cleanliness, its beautiful terrace, its proximity to many good restaurants and all that is offers. I came here from Darful tired and I left completely rested and rejuvinated. Thanks to everyone in Agora Life who has made my stay pleasant and memorable. It is a small family hotel where the manager and the owners are around to see and interact with the guests. Trust me if you have had a cup of tea on the roof, you will never forget this hotel Rhoda A. Rageh UNAMID Darfur, Rhoda Rageh UNAMID Darful

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Views in a Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: FrrequentTraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights in the Santa Sophia suite and worth the cost! Views are simply wonderful, and you are also only one floor down from the roof terrace where we spent many happy hours. Staff are very friendly and welcoming, and went out of their way to help us settle in when we arrived, including giving us breakfast as we had arrived on a very early flight. Breakfast ok, but milk etc needs replenishing more frequently. Picky perhaps, but the room would benefit from nicer toiletries (White Company, Molten Brown, L'Occitaine en Provence etc) which would normally be standard in a room costing â‚¬329 a night. Shower was weak, and kept going hot and cold. And the one glass of wine I ordered came from a bottle which was corked. Housekeeping service was excellent and room looked immaculate when we returned each day.Overall, I would recommend it, and would certainly return. Location is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Okan A
Reviews.Content: Right in the heart of Istanbul's tourist district (Sultanahmet) this hotel is 10 minutes walk from St Sophia, Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace. Also close to trams and the Eminonu pier for boat trips. The room we stayed in was small but comfortable. There is a great terrace with a fantastic view of St Sophia and over the Bosphorus. Don't miss! The staff on the front desk are incredibly helpful and talk excellent English. Breakfast is excellent with plenty of variety and an omelette option. Also good value for money. All in all the perfect place to stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Full of Eastern Promise”
Reviews.Author: Jeanniebean44
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in the hotel 27 - 30 March. It was perfectly located in the Sultanahmet area (old Town) off the main street. Being the old town this street was very narrow and at certain busy times taxis are unable to drive along to the hotel because of parked cars ... it is a feature of the busy life at peak times in the old town. Our taxi driver dropped us off in the main street at the head of the sreet the hotel was located in and we trundled our case along the pavement to the hotel where a member of staff was outside waiting to welcome us in. This minor inconvnience was a small price to pay for an otherwise perfectly located hotel. On checking in we were given excellent information on tram journeys i.e. where they run to and where to get tokens, sightseeing trips, nearby restaurants and the main important sights only a few minutes walk from the hotel. We were also given information on a business card size of opening and closing times of about 12 close by sights. The view from the terrace was amazing. The Turkish breakfast was colourful and plentiful and omellettes could be ordered if desired. Our room was bijou. but we didn't plan to spend time in it and it was well appointed with a julliet balcony which provided an excellent view of the building across the very narrow street.Quaint. Sometimes you have to give a little to gain a lot and locality and roof terrace are fabulous. We were celebrating a significant wedding anniversary and the little thoughtful touches from the hotel in recognising this were much appreciated. Our room was tastefully decorated and had a stocked minibar, for purchasing from, and a safe.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful small hotel”
Reviews.Author: MuWG
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff, helpful and friendly, clean room, very good service, comfortable bed,phantastic view from the roof -terrace and the suites, sumptuous breakfast buffet. Close to most important sights (walking distance), close to tram station. All features as described on web-site! Good fish-restaurant nearby. A place to stay again and to recommend to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Mixedreviews
Reviews.Content: If you are a first time visitor and want to be within walking distance to the major historic sights, the Agora Life fits the bill. We stayed on the top floor in a suite which was not opulent but charming. The rooms are clean, the staff is really helpful and the the breakfast buffet is nice--the coffee exceptional. There is a very good fish restaurant around the corner but a late night cocktail cannot be found in this neighborhood. We really enjoyed the walking tour guide they recommended. All in all, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for exploring Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: 27Thetraveller
Reviews.Content: Ideally placed in Old Istanbul, this hotel was an excellent place to stay. The rooms are clean and modern. Staff were friendly, helpful and informative from start to finish, the extensive breakfast buffet set you up for the day and the views from the roof terrace were simply stunning. It was very good value for money and I would have no hesitation in recommending it!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, few steps to best places of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: DoriH
Reviews.Content: Small hotel, totally renovated, nice room and bathroom, clean and cosy. View from the room: Haghia Sofia. Nice staff. Good buffet breakfast. Welcome-gift: fruits + big bottle of mineral water every day. I was upgraded to deluxe room on arrival. 24h reception. Free wifi. Beautiful view from the top terrace. 3 min to Haghia Sofia, 5 min to the Grand Bazaar. 2 min to Starbucks. 1 min to an excellent, 300 years old turkish bath. All Sultanahmet sights are within an easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base”
Reviews.Author: Abby_Beth
Reviews.Content: Having read other reviews we were hopeful that the hotel was going to live up to its reputation and it did. Lovely helpful staff, clean rooms, comfy beds, tasteful decor, nice toiletries, good breakfast. It's located between Sultanahmet and Gulhane tram stops so brilliant for sightseeing in the Old Town. Would have no qualms recommending this hotel to anyone. If your budget can stretch to it the Hagia Sophia suite has amazing views!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel and Service!!”
Reviews.Author: MeyRoy
Reviews.Content: Just got back from holiday in Istanbul, and could not wait to share my experience at Agora Life Hotel. Let me tell you all about it! :) We were four American girls sharing two standard rooms located on the ground floor (L01) and first floor (102) of the hotel. Location: Agora Life is located off a major street, less than Â½ a block up an alley way (loved this as it was very quiet during the night). It is a 5-10 minute walk to most must see attractions like: Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Basilica Cistern, Grand Bazaar. Near great restaurants (My favorite Sultanahmet Fish House Restaurant),a tram stop, a grocery store, and a stoneâ€™s throw from a wonderful Turkish bath house (Caguloglu) Accommodations: Our room (L01) was equipped with two closets providing enough space for all of our belongings, a full size couch, and a safe. The overall layout of the room is small, but it was perfect for us. We loved that on a daily basis it was kept nice and clean, never did we have to ask for anything. The bathroom was always stocked up with toiletries, clean towels, and we were given bottled water, tea, coffee, and fruit. The hotel also provides bathrobes and slippers to be used by guests during their stay. They have free Wi-Fi throughout the hotel. I had a hard time connecting on my phone from our room, but my other friends did not have a problem so it could have just been my phone. However that was not even an issue, as the hotel has a laptop computer in the lobby for guest to use. The speed is fast, never had any connectivity issues. I was able to upload pictures on a daily basis to send back home to friends and family. It was also nice to hang out in the lobby as the staff always offered something to drink, and would answer questions and provide suggestions as to the things that we should include on our daily itinerary. THE TERRACE is A-mazing, it has spectacular views of the water and Hagia Sophia. That terrace was witness to many crazy photo shoots of the four of us. I went up there during sunrise and sunsets and Oh boy! was the view breathtaking! Complimentary Breakfast: One wordâ€¦ DELICIOUS!! AND if you miss your scrambled eggs or omelets all you have to do is ask and they will kindly prepare them for you. Hotel Staff: This is the part where I get teary eyedâ€¦. I actually miss ALL of them!! :P They were all very nice, kind, and friendly. On day one, Isa (front desk) sat with us for a while as we drank tea going over the places that might be of interest to us, he explained how we should get there, what means of transportation we should use, etc. etc. Furkan (bellman) was quick to help us to our rooms, adjusted our roomâ€™s heater so that we were comfortable. Kadir (hotel manager) always answering our questions with a smile, and providing that personal attention that made us feel at home. Irfan (hotel owner) was so kind when he unexpectedly presented us with gifts (scarves) that will always remind us of beautiful Istanbul and their hospitality. I canâ€™t forget about Eser (front desk) who helped with entertainment reservations and Cagdas (bellman) who even provided my friend with a grocery list when she inquired about the preparation of our breakfast. I highly recommend this place!! You will not regret it! When you do visit tell them that their new found friend (and hopefully returning guest) remembers them dearly!!! -Nancy

Reviews.Title: “Just lovely.”
Reviews.Author: Thumbalina528
Reviews.Content: Essentials of choosing a hotel when traveling: location, cleanliness, service, and affordability. Agora Life had it all, and then some. It was just minutes from great restaurants, the Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, the Grand Bazaar, the tram, a great turkish bathhouse, etc. I honestly dont think I needed to leave a ten minute walking radius of the hotel, at any time. On top of that, the hotel has a beautiful terrace, with an amazing view of the Hagia Sophia and the water. The rooms are clean, and are stocked with water and fruits everyday. Their free breakfast buffet is A-mazing. They have assortments of meat, cheeses, bread, veggies, fruits, juices, yogurt, etc. It never got old. The staff is incredibly nice, and helpful. The internet worked perfectly, and the place is decorated so cute. I do have to say, it's not the biggest place, especially compared to the hotels in the U.S., but it's a cute boutique hotel, located in the heart of Istanbul. I love boutique hotels, and especially Agora Life. I had an amazing time there, and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely quiet location”
Reviews.Author: Ruth_Teddington
Reviews.Content: Lovely friendly staff, nice rooms (if a bit small), breakfast and rooftop terrace. Centrally located next to all the major attractions. Tip: Early October was a nice time to go - not too hot but a bit windy.

Reviews.Title: “Girls Week in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: LifeTourist1980
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely fabulous. The rooms are smallish, but clean and modern. The beds are super comfy and the bathroom is beautiful. It is on a small street so not a lot of traffic below. The breakfast is enough to get you through the day, but who wants to do that in Istanbul with so much awesome food. The owner, manager, and staff have been incredibly helpful and accommodating. The owner even gave me and my girlfriends pashminas for the cold weather outside. Love, love, love this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “my home in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Mohammed R
Reviews.Content: this is not only hotel for me it's my 2nd house in Istanbul , this is the 2nd time i stay in this wonderful hotel it's relaxing the staff are very helpful and very very kind the room is clean and contain every think you may need the wireless is very strong and fast the location is great Hagia Sophia and Sultan Ahmad (blue Mosque ) are very near finally what i can say is it's Excellent hotel

Reviews.Title: “A very nice stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: antero v
Reviews.Content: We would recommend this hotel to anyone. It was relly clean, modern, pretty and convienient. Very helpful and friendly staff. We have stayed in many Istanbul hotels since I have worked for two years in Turkey. This was the best in this price category.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Daria k
Reviews.Content: When I choose a hotel, my first priority is the location and the price. When I arrived to Agora Life, it is more than my expectations. The staff was helpful and really nice. The rooms are clean and it is decorated simple and chic at the same time. The location was perfect, really close to the historical places and yet still silent in the evening. I definately recommend this hotel to all my friends. thanks for everything

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel and very caring people”
Reviews.Author: xianfeng l
Reviews.Content: We're two tourists from China,it's our second time to stay in Agoralife Hotel. The hotel owner is a great guy,very caring,everyone works in this hotel is so kind, The breakfast is awesome,and the room service is incomparable.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in the heart of the old city...”
Reviews.Author: GRSimpson
Reviews.Content: Agora Life is a marvelous little hotel in comfortable walking distance of most of the main attractions in the old city - and not so much of a hike to the Egyptian Spice Bazaar and Suleymaniye Mosque (our favorite in Istanbul). Close to a couple of tram stops, too, and they are excellent and inexpensive. Istanbul really is one of the world's most remarkable cities and we loved it... In the coldest week in the city for 30 years, the hotel was a toasty, warm haven (excellent heating and a heated towel rail in the bathroom). Some top restaurants very close, as well, so not far to go for a good feed on a cold winter's night. Our room was small but the bed was really comfy and a king size. Boutique-style facilities and very clean. Lovely staff and the information provided and help with bookings was excellent. And the breakfasts included in the room cost were plentiful and delicious: a good mix too, including beautiful yoghurt and muesli, excellent breads, salads, boiled eggs, wonderful sausage rolls using spicy Turkish sauces etc. Best b'nb in 9 months of travel in Europe and USA. The room also had a safe, something that a lot of hoteliers really underestimate the value of. Leaving passports, laptops etc in safety is a real asset (no reflection on the hotel staff, by the way)...Too few have had the in our travels (advice to hoteliers: add this high up in your list of resources!). So why not a 5? Well, we realized this was a place in the heart of town, but the last couple of nights we needed ear plugs to cancel out the horrendous door-doof music coming from nearby. Not the hotel's fault but up till then we had opened a window for some fresh air. Hard to say if this is a regular thing - but in summer you'd really need an open window, it'd be hard to tolerate. However...would I stay at the Agora Life again? You bet!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: emily t
Reviews.Content: Chic boutique hotel with an AWESOME location. we stayed here in the middle of a blizzard (!) and were still able to get out to see all the sites. the concierge is helpful, polite, generous and the rooms are clean with great sheets. the rooms are on the small side, but you won't be in them much in this neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ChrisAmablin82
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Istanbul and we chose this hotel on the strength of the reviews, we were not disappointed. The staff were very friendly and on arrival they took the time to show us where we were on the map in relation to all the touristy things to see, giving us plenty of advice and information on how to make the most of the stay - places to visit, eat, drink, even a full schedule of which days different places were open, which made planning our 4 days there really straight forward. Later in the week they were knowledgeable on local trips to take and booked us an afternoon trip at no extra charge. The hotel itself is clean, modern and our room had an excellent large bed. View from the room was nothing to write home about, however the terrace on the 5th floor has excellent views and I can imagine it would be a great place to have an evening drink in the summer (bit too cold this time of year). The buffet breakfast was decent, with a good variety of food, plus the hotel is conveniently near a small supermarket too, which is a money saver if you're into preparing your lunch. Easy walking distance to the Blue Mosque and Grand Bazaar. We walked to the fish markets and back easily too. Close to the tram lines, so easy to get to from the airport. Thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel with great service in a great city.”
Reviews.Author: Marc C
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Agora Life in mid-January after reading other excellent reviews and having seen the photos of the roof terrace. After arriving relatively late the service from all staff was outstanding throughout our stay and the hotel was clean, comfortable and very reasonably priced. It is only a short walk to all the attractions in Istanbul and there are plenty of good restaurants close by. The staff were excellent to us, showing us the best places to go, making phone calls to other locations on our behalf and even ordering us a pizza when we arrived late. On our last day we were faced with a long walk to the Metro in the cold and pouring rain - the hotel arranged for a shuttle bus at no extra cost! If visiting this hotel I would recommend using the Metro to Sultanahmet from the airport as it is easy and a real experience. Will certainly be booking to come back at some time - ideally in the summer when it's a bit warmer.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, wonderful stay....”
Reviews.Author: RollerRoyalty
Reviews.Content: We love the hotel for many reasons. The staff was amazing, and did everything they possibly could to make our stay comfortable. Even waking up to a power outage...we were greeted with breakfast by candle light, and somehow...hot coffee! The hotel itself was lovely, very clean, reasonably priced in a great location. We will definitely go back to this hotel when we travel to Istancool again.....

Reviews.Title: “a few winter days in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Alexander B
Reviews.Content: Honestly AgoraLife hotel has been booked by chance. We (my wife and myself) just looked for a reasonably priced hotel in the city centre and simply found it in Internet. We were lucky and the hotel appeared to beautiful! Very friendly and hospital personal, nice location within 5 minute walking distance from Aya Sofia and Blue Mosque, splendid roof terrace... everything was really great! The hotel is small and quiet and city noise doesn't reach it. Nice fish reastourant next door. We've been in Istanbul for the first time and enjoyed Turkish hospitality a lot. Istanbul in winter is a real magic place. It is a pity we had only five days there and our dream is to go there again. And of course to stay in AgoraLife!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Cape Town, Western Cape, South Africa
Reviews.Title: “Fantastic boutique accommodation in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: Marlise P
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Agora Life Hotel for five nights in January 2012 and were so impressed with the excellent service, friendliness of the staff, stunning rooms and views! Centrally-located in Sultanahmet and very close to the Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Basilica Cistern, Grand Bazaar, little restaurants and shops as well as tram stations, it's the perfect base from which to explore the magnificent city of Istanbul. The breakfast buffet was really varied and delicious and I would suggest ordering a bottle of wine to sip on while enjoying the views from the roof terrace - they even presented us with a sumptious veggie and cheese board for free when we ordered wine! Rooms are cleaned daily, are elegant and come with complimentary slippers and nightgowns and other nice goodies. You also get a bottle of water for free daily. I will recommend this hotel to other travellers, it's really made our stay in Istanbul super-duper wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Home is where Agora Life is!”
Reviews.Author: Zara Z
Reviews.Content: Agora Life accommodated us at a very busy time of year, and that too for 10 nights. Not only was the service excellent, but we became part of the Agora Life family by the end of our stay. Each and every staff member was bright, cheerful, helpful and in the warmest manner possible. The people at reception, Kadir, Isa, all of them took care in giving us personal attention and helped arrange our outings every day. The location is perfect because it is literally a 2-minute walk from the Aya Sophia and the most happening and magical 'Sultanahmet' area. This puts it at a perfect distance from the Tram station making it a very good location for tourists who want to remain mobile. The views from the rooms are breathtaking. Our room had a view of an Ancient Hamam on one side and the Bosphorus on the other. Our other room in the last three days had a view of the Aya Sophia, the Topkapi Palace and the Bosphorus Bridge that just being in that room was like going sightseeing. Everyday we found our room spick and span, with an inviting complementary bunch of hot drinks to warm us up. Never has any hotel made us feel this special not only as customers but as people. We became so comfortable over there, physically in the fantastic rooms and otherwise with the hotel environment, that it was like leaving home by the end. We made some lasting friendships with everyone at the hotel and Agora Life helped make the Turkey experience complete! P.s. Don't forget to try their delicious Turkish delights at reception.They are the best I've ever had!

Reviews.Title: “First class boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: carolinerevell
Reviews.Content: Being encouraged by other reviews I booked this hotel for our 4 night stay in Istanbul. We were certainly not disappointed and I wholeheartedly recommend a stay here. We had the Bosphorus suite which afforded outstanding views of the Topkapi Palace, the Golden Horn/Bosphorus and the Hagia Sophia as well as the Galata Tower. The hotel is immaculate and the staff go out of their way to make your stay as comfortable as possible. The Agora Life is tucked along a quiet side street which makes for peaceful sleeping but absolutely central to everything within the old quarter. Breakfasts were a European buffet style with freshly made cooked dishes to order. There are a whole host of fabulous little restaurants within a stones throw for lunch and dinner A laptop is provided within the lobby for guests' use. The hotel has a super little library of guide books which we made good use of. We had a super trip to Istanbul and will certainly return to the Agora Life.

Reviews.Title: “Livin' the Life at Agora Life Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OfficeTravelLeague
Reviews.Content: I just came back from visiting Istanbul for a week. I randomly booked the Agora Life and I'm so happy I did because this place is awesome. The rooms were comfortable, clean, modern and I had an amazing view from the Bosphorus suite. The front desk staff were extremely friendly, helpful and they spoke English. They gladly helped me arrange for a private guide, taxis, reservations at restaurants, etc. The level of outstanding customer service and attention to detail made me feel like I was staying at a really nice apartment building with a front desk that I had known for years. I never felt anything less than their best and most important customer and the other guests I spoke to felt the exact same way. The breakfast downstairs was great. Lots of cereals, breads and cheeses. The breakfast attendant, Ugor (sp?), also made me eggs sunny-sided up every morning without any extra fuss. Towards the end of my stay, he had the eggs ready for me and I didn't even have to ask. That kind of attention to detail and willingness to go above and beyond was typical of my stay at Agora Life. Lastly, the location was ideal to tour the old city. It's easily 5 minutes away from Hagia Sofia. It's about a 15 minute taxi ride from the bars and clubs of Taxim but the ride was about 18 Turkish Lira. I personally liked staying but the old stuff and then taking a taxi to the bars at night. Agora Life is perfectly situated so you can visit some historic stuff, walk back to the hotel to rest and then go back out at night. My friends and I walked around during the day, came back, rested and then took a taxi to go out. OVERALL - Customer service and a great deal are really important to me. I know there are other hotels that are slightly cheaper than Agora Life but I would gladly pay the extra few dollars to stay at a nice hotel that's clean, modern, perfectly situated and that comes with great customer service. -Nicole, Lindsay and Stacy

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room, helpful and friendly owner and a superb location”
Reviews.Author: Aldy_1982
Reviews.Content: I only stayed for one night at Agora Life but it was excellent. Kadir, the owner, was really helpful and arranged an excursion for me as well as finding a good Turkish Hamam for me to visit nearby. Every time we chatted he was quick to offer me a delicious glass of Turkish tea. The room I stayed in was quite small but very comfortable and the decor is modern with new furniture and flat screen tv. There was free fruit and water on arrival which is a nice touch. The location is fantastic - 5 minutes from the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. There is a superb fish restaurant on the road called Sultanahmet fish house too. Overall a wonderful place to stay and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Small & Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Joao74
Reviews.Content: Agora Life made our first trip to Istambul a very pleasant surprise. The Hotel has a top location near the old part of town and the main attractions. It's a small and familiar hotel with small but comfy rooms, and all very clean and new. We started our trip staying there and had a minor problem with the shower, when we came back before returning home they upgrade us to the suite for free :) What a rest before our flight. And with amazing views! Tip: Grab a beer from the mini bar and watch the sunset in the rooftop - Amazing views

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: deepthi a
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located, within walking distance from Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and other points of interest like the grand bazaar.It was clean and nice.The staff were very quick to help us with any questions and very friendly. All in all a great hotel with a lot to offer in its surrounding area.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: atishma
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, great location, clean rooms. Very friendly staff. Special mention to Mr khadir who is very helpful with organising trips and sight seeing. Definitely recommend it. Atishma

Reviews.Title: “Great place and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Preeti N
Reviews.Content: Visited with set of friends and had a fun stay in Istanbul.. enjoyed our stay at Agora life , excellent staff and service, very welcoming and helpful! the hotel is perfectly situated , just 5 min walk,in the centre of so many of Istanbuls major attractions.Great place and would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: TatumTravel
Reviews.Content: The staff made my boyfriend and I feel so welcomed the moment we walked in. They introduced us to Istanbul by showing us all the sites that the city has to offer. The location is fantastic! 5-minute walk to the Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, the Palace, the train system in the city and the ferry. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Family fun in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: C P
Reviews.Content: The Agora Life Hotel was fantastic. We were traveling with small children, and the staff couldn't have been more accomidating. We sayed in the Santa Sophia suite with the best view of both the Santa Sophia from one window and the bridge from the other window. Our room was nicely sized with plenty of room- so those of you who like a large room should upgrade to the suite. Breakfast was wonderful, lots of choices for any taste. The staff went out of their way to help us in every way. And of course the location is amazing. 10 minute walk to Santa Sophia and Blue Mosque. I would recommend Agora Life to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Best location and customer service par excellence!!”
Reviews.Author: CokGuzel01
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in AGora Life between 22 to 28 Oct 2011 and I thought of writing and letting all fellow travellers know what a terrific time we had!! Agora will be the best hotels we have stayed in during our trip and we would like to thank you all the hotel staff that made it happen for us. Everything was superb about Agora - right from its fabulous location, to quality breakfasts with personalised touches (eg eggs the way we liked it thanks to Ayse Cakmak and Furkan Sarli). The amenities in the room were very nice too. We very much remember the way Isa Bey made us immediately feel at home, especially when we arrived late in the evening, very tired and dissapointed that a taxi driver took us for a ride! However, the thing that stood out amongst all the positive experiences we have had in Agora was the level of customer service of the hotel manager Mr Kadir Bey. We have travelled a lot in the world, and I can assure you that the customer service he provided us, be it in the form of his knowledge and expertise, promptness - all have been of the highest standard. We will never forget this and when we vist Istanbul again, we hope to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mickb59
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've used Agora Life and again I've not been dissapointed. It has a near perfect location for just about every attraction in Sultanahmet and possibly the best terrice view of any hotel in the area. The staff are very helpfull and so friendly. I would highly recommend Agora Life.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay, Highly Recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Sayema K
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and great service. I travelled to Turkey with my 4 month old baby. Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Rooms are well equipped but not very spacious. Location is probably the best, centrally located. 5 minutes walking distance from Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Basilica Cistern, Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazar. Terrace has very good view of Bosphorous Strait and Hagia Sophia. Hotel made arrangements for our Bosphorous Cruise. Agora Life Hotel made our stay in Istanbul a pleasant one. Highly Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “The best of The best”
Reviews.Author: wagnerItajai
Reviews.Content: The staff make us feel at home;better than home, cause we didn't have to wash the dishes... At the check-in they give us a very warm and kindly reception showing on the map places to visit and things to do, that makes our stay a lot easier. All of our requests were attended. I recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, quietly elegant, boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: DarjeelingTiger
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel, friendly Turkish service and staff. Felt very genuine and warm welcome. I was travelling alone and am female and felt very comfortable. The decor is elegant and modern with a good touch of Turkish style. Rooms are not large (Americans, be warned!). But it is very central in a very busy city so this is normal - they are very well equipped and a good use of the space. Amazing view from my room. Location for first time visitors to Istanbul would be hard to beat. I recommend this hotel for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: michael r
Reviews.Content: Fabulous people, fabulous location, fabulous breakfast. Best spot in Istanbul to stay. Don't miss the rooftop.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Sultanahment”
Reviews.Author: o2go
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a 5 night stay at this lovely boutique hotel. It's ideally located in a quiet street within walking distance of the sights of the Sultanahmet, and with easy access to the tram across to Taksim Square, and a short walk to the main pier on the Bosphorous. Modern, comfortable, clean rooms, some ( especially the two suites) with lovely views. Mr Kadir Cikan and his staff provide a very friendly helpful service, including airport transfers. A great base for our first visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RJAB77
Reviews.Content: If you visit Istanbul, stay in this hotel. It is perfectly located - 10 minute walk to the Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque and Grand Bazaar. Clean and tidy rooms - we upgraded to a room with a view, but if you can't do that they have a terrace with amazing views in any event. The room also came with daily complimentary water, fruit and a bottle of wine. As well as all of this, by far the best thing about this hotel is the staff all of whom were incredibly friendly and helpful. Any questions we had before we arrived we answered by e-mail within hours and once we did arrive they went out of their way to help. A smile and a 'hello' is very simple but I have not been anywhere else where it is genuinely provided by every member of staff.

Reviews.Title: “Agora Hotel Stay in October”
Reviews.Author: abbie32
Reviews.Content: We Stayed at the Agora early October for 4 nights. The Included pick up at the airport after a 10 hour flight was perfect. The hotel check in was a great experience. A cup of tea with the manager and any information we needed was immediately provided. All the staff at this hotel could not have been more helpful. Rooms small but clean and well appointed. Very quiet and great for sleeping. The terrace had wonderful views of the city and Bosphorous. Breakfasts very good. Fruits cereals breads and omelettes if wanted. Fish restaurant near the hotel was so good we ate there twice. Location, location, location was perfect

Reviews.Title: “Very nice property”
Reviews.Author: JillAnnY1966
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Agora Life Hotel in early October and cannot hesitate to recommend it. The rooms, though a tad small, are immaculately clean and comfortable and the staff was excellent. The location can't be beat. It's very close to all of the great sites in Sutlanahmet. I would recommend it to anyone and would stay there again in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: danM60763
Reviews.Content: This is a really great hotel, reasonable priced rooms, modern, clean, friendly staff, great breakfast, and close to many good sites...i would recommend this hotel to anyone and would certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel - and perfect location too”
Reviews.Author: basilcat98
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly recommend this hotel. We stayed there 6 nights with a one night gap in the middle (to visit Gallipolli and Troy). As others have said the hotel service is really good and the staff could not have been more helpful, especially Isa. The bedrooms are very tastefully decorated and well equipped (although basic rooms were a little small - the owner upgraded us for our last two nights and that room was perfect - so pay a bit more if you can). The breakfast is lovely, varied and fresh - and very good omelettes to order. The view from the roof terrace is just stunning and the perfect place to watch the sunset while sipping a cool beer or wine. Lastly, the hotel location is just perfect - all the main sights in the Sultanahmet are within 10 mins walk max and the tram stop just 5 mins away. Plenty of restaurants to try nearby - but the best one we found is about 50 foot away from the hotel - the Fish House restaurant. Try the sea bass cooked in sea salt, or share a hot appetiser of shrimps and mushrooms cooked in butter. Once again the owner and his staff were really friendly too. All in all a very memorable holiday, in large part thanks to the Agora Life Hotel and its staff.

Reviews.Title: “Superb experience in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Stienie M
Reviews.Content: Towards the end of October we ended a lovely overseas trip with 2 nights in Istanbul. We were greeted by a very kind Mr Cikan and his team at the Agora Life Hotel. He gave us very helpful info on how to get around, especially since we had limited time. The hotel is an absolute gem in the heart of Sultanahmet. The rooms, bathrooms, breakfast and rooftop terrace were of top quality. We couldn't have asked for more! Conveniently located, we could pass by during the day to drop off shopping or have a beer on the rooftop and enjoy the spectacular view of the Bosporus, Hagia Sophia and the rest of Istanbul. All sights were within 10 min walk from the hotel. I would definately recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very central, friendly hotel with hepful staff”
Reviews.Author: Victoria R
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for visiting Istanbul with a very central location and friendly, helpful staff who gave us some great tips on things to see and do. A wonderful terrace on the top floor with a great view of Aya Sophia and the city. We highly recommend the Agora Life!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location in Old Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: sweetafton
Reviews.Content: We were 10 minutes walk from the Grand Bazaar and from there we took the train for 2 Turkish Liras to the Spice Bazaar. The same train would continue to the New Istanbul at Taksim Square, where western hotels abound. All train trips cost 2 TL each time. We walked to the Mosques, museums, Topkapi Palace, restaurants. Staff at Agora Life were incredily helpful and friendly. I had bought a leather jacket and found a defect after i had come back to the hotel. The hotel manager called the shop, explained the defect, and got it to send a car to fetch us to the shop for alterations, and send us back to the hotel. Room amenities like complimentary wi-fi, electronic safe, tea+coffee making facilities, flat panel TV, were very much appreciated. The lobby has a very homey sitting area with curios, library of reference and travel books, plus I think books put there by the hotel and other books left behind by other travellers. And a jar of fresh turkish delight to help yourself. The view from the 5th floor Terrace is fantastic. We spent every evening watching the sun set, with beer and wine in hand and some snacks. And after, we would walk out to dinner at a nearby restaurant. We stayed 3D/3N only and wished we had a few more days. The hotel owner was at the lobby when we checked out. He presented me a gift of a scarf as a souvenir from the hotel. Very thoughtful and very unexpected.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely well located hotel in the heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: mariadovan
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is its extremely convenient location. It is within less than 10 minutes from the landmark sites of Istanbul. The service was good, the room very clean, and we had breakfast on the open terrace which gave a great view of the city. The other best thing was that the staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. They did everything to make us feel welcomed. Should we return to Istanbul tomorrow, Agora Life is definitely the place where we would stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: Batutta
Reviews.Content: The Agora Life is centrally located but in a quiet neighborhood. The view of the Golden Horn, Bosporus, Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sofia, from the rooftop terrace is spectacular. We spend a lot of time sitting on the terrace and enjoying the breeze. The staff are friendly and eager to accommodate. Very good value for the cost. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: StinaBergen_Norge
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice weekend in Istanbul staying at this hotel. The service was splendid and the room(perfect for 3) was very special because of its brilliant view in two directions. Hagia Sofia and sea/town(The pictures from the suite doesnt lie..) There was a lovely roof top terrace with a fantastic view also. Nice breakfast, friendly people and a very good location. I loved this place and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and quality”
Reviews.Author: Cerpintaxt
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel while fleeing from an extremely bad quality hotel! They accomodated us at extremely short notice in an immaculately clean, stylish and comfortable room for an extremely reasonable price. The breakfast was extremely varied and representative of proper turkish food and the staff were all very polite and helpful. Of note, this hotel is on the opposite side of the Sultanahmet away from the more tourist-y areas and as such offers a nicer quiter area to explore with good local resturants and tea bars. Dont be put off by the fact that the hotel is in a small alley, it just means you get a quiet night's sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Agora Life - Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: acemin
Reviews.Content: We (myself and 5 other people) stayed at Agora Life after reading reviews on Trip Advisor. I noticed while there a plaque was displayed on the wall of the hotel with 4.5 star rating by Trip Advisor, I give the hotel 5 stars! The location is exceptional for walking to everything one would want to see while in Istanbul. The hotel is very clean and they are very accommodating to their patrons. The manager Kadir and his staff are very welcoming. They were very helpful in helping us map our daily tours, shopping, and restaurant expeditions. The views from the terrace are quite breathtaking and enjoying our breakfast from there was a daily bonus. As you can see by reading, our stay in Istanbul was very enjoyable and I credit the staff at Agora Life for helping make it such a special trip. A thank you to Kadir, and to all of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Daniel Z
Reviews.Content: Fantastic - Intimate Hotel. We stayed 3 nights with two other friends and had a "special" time. Can't say enough about the location to all the main sites in Sultanahemet, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar, Spice Market, Palace and much more. Kadir, the manager and his staff are extremely friendly and accomodate all your needs. The owner presented our wifes with a nice gift at the end of our stay. This was a very nice touch. I highly recommend staying in one of the two rooms on the 4th floor as the views are spectacular of the Bosphorus. Our nightly visits to the open terrace on the 5th floor was a nitely event with a evening drink with wonderful views of the city lights and Bosphorus Bridge. The owner stated that the terrace will be even better in the future. We felt very safe in the area - even walking at night. I also highly recommend the Fish House restaurant on the corner - get the sea bass cooked in sea salt - great evening with friends and new friends.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it and we will ba back!”
Reviews.Author: kate19800507
Reviews.Content: the service was good the room was very good Talk about the location & amenities-very good!

Reviews.Title: “Ideally situated and warm welcome”
Reviews.Author: Caroline T
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights and were greatly satisfied. The hotel is situated 5 minutes from all the main attractions and tramway. We received a warm welcome and the owner took the time to hand us a city map and give us some ideas of the sites to visit. The hotel is on a calm street with very little circulation. The staff speaks well in English and always welcomed us with a smile. Our room on the second floor was clean and well furnished. The shower is rather small and water would spill allover, but it was only a small dissagreement. We do not recommend this hotel for light sleepers, as the noise insulation is poor: we would hear if our neighboor took his shower or if someone would come up the stairs. Thankfully, the hotel has only 16 rooms so there was very little circulation. The room provides a safe, but it is not screwed into the closet so we did not leave our personal belongings in it. Despite these details, we do recommend this hotel and would definitively come back! Make sure to stop by the terrase on the 5th floor to get a private view of the Bosphorus and Santa Sophia!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: coober
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel suited to couples or singles but little small for Families. Perfect location for exploring old Sultanahemet. All the major sights are within walking distance, and there are plenty of restaurants and shops for all the bids and pieces. The staff are very helpful and I could not fault our stay at this Charming little hotel. Great rooftop terrace with views over Istanbul. Basic rooms not big but spotless and beds are very comfy. Breakfast was very good. Excellent Value!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Pamela579
Reviews.Content: We had a fantasic time. The Agora Life hotel is an excellent boutique hotel situated in the heart of the tourist area of old Istanbul. It is within walking distance of the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia ,the grand bazaar and other great shopping oppurtunities and restaurants. The rooms are very clean and they have a great roof top sitting area with a view to die for. The helpful and polite staff really enhanced our experience. A special thanks to Mr Kadir for his great effort. We highly recommend this hotel.We will be back. Thank-you very much.

Reviews.Title: “Probably one of the best hotels in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Teddyx
Reviews.Content: Everything was amazing about this hotel. The staff members were incredibly polite and helpful, the rooms were clean and comfortable and the location is extremely central yet quiet. Most importantly, though, this hotel has a rooftop terrace with a breathtaking view of the Bosphorus. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel in the Old City”
Reviews.Author: LoveandLuck_6
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our honeymoon in Turkey, a week of which was in Istanbul. The Agora Life Hotel is central to the best Old Istanbul has to offer: it is located a walk away from the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, the Basilica Cisterns, and Aya Sofia (the view of which is absolutely breathtaking from the hotel's sunny rooftop terrace). You'll have easy and convenient access to public transportation, and a taxi to the popular Taksim area is only 10 Turkish Lira. Location, location, location... Aside from that, this charming boutique hotel opened its doors in 2010, so it is modern (but not too modern) in style, and in very good condition (although we did have a bit of trouble with leakage from our shower in room 201). Our room was clean and well-kempt, and although quite small--something that isn't uncommon in Istanbul's tourist-packed hotels--it was all we needed for a good night's sleep and a refreshing shower on a hot day. But what is most striking about this hotel is the service: Isa, Arken, and all their coworkers were so personable, helpful, generous with their time, and beyond accommodating, we wouldn't consider any other hotel should we return to Istanbul. By the end of our trip, we considered them friends. Many thanks to all of them for making our time in Istanbul so memorable!

Reviews.Title: “we loved it and e will be back”
Reviews.Author: jamal306
Reviews.Content: the location is a ideal on for the tourist and the hotel staff are freindly. we can all the tourist destination by walking only

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, like to come again”
Reviews.Author: louisSurhuisterveen
Reviews.Content: A fantastic hotel, nice people who help you and a cosy atmosphere. Situated in the middle of sulthanamet near all the interesting historical buildings at a walking distance. The rooms are comfortable and clean, the food is good. At the terrace at the top there is a magnificant view over the city and the bosphorus, it is good to relax there and enjoy the beautiful view. The staff is extremely helpful and nice. I would recomment this hotel to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed!”
Reviews.Author: Pedro3321
Reviews.Content: Wonderful small, clean, friendly boutique style hotel very close to the Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque - no more than 5 or 10 minutes walk away. By the way, the roof terrace is tranquility itself with beautiful views - perhaps more time should be spent here!! We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “It felt like home, BUT MUCH NICER :)”
Reviews.Author: IstanbulKadin
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my boyfriend and some of our friends and the staff was so accomodating and helpful. They helped us organize taxis and select day trips and offered tea and snacks to us, too :) The owner, Irfan, and main concierge, Isa, were gems!!!! I most definitely want to return to this hotel when I return to the great city of Istanbul!!!! Rooms were clean and modern and the terrace has one of the most beautiful views of Istanbul that I saw during my time there.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic View and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Belbjorck
Reviews.Content: Very good value for the money and good advice from the staff and also very good restaurants close to the hotel. Maria Josefa Belmonte Hernandez

Reviews.Title: “Best staf and location”
Reviews.Author: Hamed2
Reviews.Content: I think this is one of the best hotels in instanbul in sultan Ahmet area ( excellent location friendly and very helpful staff ) I recommend this hotel strongly . Good look for all

Reviews.Title: “Perfekt for first stay in a big city”
Reviews.Author: elodieIstanbul
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a week with friends and we were all very satisfied.This little hotel is situated in the middle of old town in Istanbul, close to everything you want to see, yet so quite, so private, very nice and with modest price. The rooms where rather small, but modern and very clean. The breakfast included in the price was also very good and staff was very nice and helpful. And above all came the terrace with its breathtaking view over the city and the Bosporus. It became our favorite place in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Detailed review of Agora Life Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rozaline
Reviews.Content: I initially planned to stay at Agora Life Hotel for a couple days and then move to other parts of Istanbul and other hotels on my two weeks vacation. But this hotel totally won me over and I ended up staying there for two weeks, with only great things to say about this fine establishment and its wonderful staff. On some days of my stay they did not have rooms available (I had not reserved in advance), and I had to stay at two nearby hotels which made me appreciate Agora Life Hotel even more. First of all, I would like to extend sincere warm thanks to the hotelâ€™s owner and staff for providing guests with such a wonderful lodging option, for their warm, genial hospitality, and exceptional service. Hotels can easily make it or break it for the overall impression of a travel destination. In this case, Agora Life Hotel and its wonderful staff were a huge factor to make my Istanbul trip a truly memorable visit. Canâ€™t wait to go back! LOCATION: Agora Life Hotel is located in the heart of the Sultanahmet, i.e., Old Town, area of Istanbul. The Sultanahmet area is home to the world famous Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazaar, among other attractions. It is the historical part of the city. Sultanahmet is perfect for visiting the historical places, but with the tram, buses, and ferries, it also provides an exceptionally convenient base for quick and easy excursions and trips to other parts of this fascinating, one-of-a-kind city. The Sultanahmet area has lots of hotels, all of which are small due to the small size of buildings in this historical area. I concluded that Agora Life Hotel had a superb, unmatched location, at least for my travel needs and preferences. It is central, within a short walk, under 10 minutes, to key points of interest. A very short walk in one direction brings you to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, etc. A very short walk, 10 minutes maximum, along a no-tourists walkway, in another direction brings you to the ferry station, the Spice Market and shopping in that area, and what became my favorite spot - the fascinating Galata Bridge and the New Mosque area. From there, you can take a ferry to the Asian side, ferries leave every 20 minutes, 15 or so minutes ride, costs 1.75 TL - great deal!; other locations along the Bosporus, etc. Or take a tram to Taksim and that side of the city. A short walk from the hotel in another direction leads you to the Grand Bazaar. The tram line is a very short walk, under 10 minutes, away. There are also ample restaurants and food outlets in proximity. At the same time, the hotel is located on a small, very quiet, tranquil street, allowing you to relax when you get back to the hotel from a busy day. The area felt very safe, even when walking alone late at night. Here I will add that Istanbul in general felt notably safe. I read about it in travel books. But still, I was amazed how safe the city felt, especially considering its size, with 15-17 million residents plus millions of tourists, and so much activity. ACCOMMODATIONS: The hotel has 16 rooms, ranging in size and view. I stayed in one of their most economical, standard rooms, facing the street. The room was small, but it made good use of space and certainly provided for a comfortable stay. This is a relatively new hotel, just over a year old. The hotel was fully renovated, tastefully, and with quality materials, such as marble, and quality appliances. Everything was in like-new condition and top repair. The hotelâ€™s overall decor was neutral, pleasing, and of neutral-modern style. Very pleasant. The rooftop terrace offers panoramic views of Hagia Sophia, Bosporus, and the city - ideal for lounging during warm summer days. GUEST ROOM: As said, I stayed in a standard, most economical room, facing the street. The room was small but very comfortable. I always looked forward to returning to its comfort after busy days exploring the city. Furnishings and amenities included small side tables, one chair, an electrical kettle, tea cups, packets of tea and coffee; a 1.5 litter bottle of water replenished daily (complimentary); minibar with enough space in it for additional items; two bathrobes and two sets of slippers. The bed was appealing, with quality bedding, and certainly provided for a comfortable night of sleep. Lighting was ample, with a ceiling light and also lamps. There was a well functioning A/C, and one could also open the window. I wish they provided a luggage rack, and there was space for it. Otherwise, the luggage had to be stretched on the floor, which was inconvenient. The bathroom was brightly lit, with quality appliances, sparkling clean, with enough towels, toiletries and counter space for guest items. The upkeep both in the bedroom and bathroom was excellent on all days, very clean throughout, with no issues to report (and I am picky!). Future guests should keep in mind that the hotel has only 16 rooms. So if you have any particular preferences, such as single or double bed, then express those clearly when making a reservation. Large hotels can easily move guests around to accommodate them, unless they are at full capacity. But with just 16 rooms and consistently high occupancy, it could be a challenge. GUEST SERVICES: The hotel has a simply exceptional team of staff! This includes the front desk, personnel at breakfast, housekeepers, - i.e., everybody that you encounter there. The front desk is staffed 24 hours. It is a small establishment, and all guests receive personalized service (without being intrusive in any way). All arriving guests are provided with a large map of Istanbul and overview of attractions. Staff will readily answer your questions and they really go out of their way to assist. Kadir at the front desk was a star performer and deserves special, warm thanks, for his sunshiny attitude, hospitality, through knowledge of Istanbul, and enthusiastic assistance. I had lots and lots of questions about sightseeing suggestions, directions, shopping etc etc, incl. some pretty focused, esoteric questions - and sure enough, Kadir could help with any of it. All staff were ready to help. If you stay at the hotel for a couple days or longer, you will likely also meet the hotel owner, who takes the time to greet and welcome guests. BREAKFAST: The breakfast was very impressive, and a huge positive factor as far as I am concerned. No need for lunch after it. They call it â€œbreakfast,â€� but it was more like a brunch. As is typical in hotels in Turkey, it provided coffee, tea, assorted juices, assorted cheeses, cucumbers, tomatoes, hard boiled eggs, bread, plain and flavored yogurt, olives, pastries, cake, and things like that. But what was rather unique for this hotel is that they also provided prepared food and offered made to order omelets. For example, they had hard boiled eggs cut and garnished with green onions and seasoning. Also, tomato salad, in addition to cherry tomatoes. Also potato salad, carrot salad. On some days they had this out-of-this-world totally delicious eggplant dish, delicately prepared with olive oil and spices. On different days they had assorted fruit and delicious strawberries. Made to order omelets were also available upon request (complimentary, part of breakfast). The food offerings were really generous and abundant. Everything was fresh and attractively, abundantly presented. All items were replenished promptly. The breakfast was from 7:30 AM till 10 AM. But staff kept replenishing food to full levels even after 10 AM, if there were guests in the dining room. On a couple of occasions I witnessed some guests who overslept the breakfast, yet the hotel staff accommodated them and provided food. INTERNET: The property provided complimentary wireless internet which functioned flawlessly. For ex., I watched a couple full-length movies on YouTUBE, and the wireless internet handled this without a glitch. The hotel also had a laptop with the internet in the lobby for guest use. ADDITIONAL IDEAS: Even though the hotel does not advertise this, but I thought this hotel could be a terrific choice for a corporate retreat, small wedding, anniversary celebration, or events like this. If it is a small group, then the entire hotel can be booked, all the 16 rooms. If an event requires more rooms, the hotel staff can easily make arrangements with nearby hotels. The hotel has a very attractive, comfortable, functional dining room, located next to their kitchen, it can easily be used for a small meeting or celebration event. The rooftop terrace, with its magnificent views of Hagia Sophia, Bosporus, and the city, could be superb for a small wedding celebration, small banquet, or event like that. They have an excellent cook as part of their staff. And there is no question that their staff has the expertise and experience, plus the work ethic, to make all the needed arrangements for events like that. Destinations like the Caribbean and Hawaii commonly accommodate weddings, corporate retreats, etc. Why not Istanbul? TIPS TO FUTURE GUESTS: (1) Do not hesitate to contact their staff for assistance. They pride themselves in providing exceptional, personalized service and will be more than happy to assist you. (2) Keep in mind that the staff knows Istanbul really well. They can easily help you with information and arrangements not just for the common tourist points of interest but also more esoteric queries and requests. (3) Contact the hotel directly through their e-mail to make the reservation. This way they can provide you with more specifics about the various room choices they have. Also, you may be able to get a better rate by booking with them directly rather than using third-party reservation systems (not sure about that, but that is the impression I got). (4) Even though the hotel does not market this (at least not to me), but they do have wine, various drinks, snacks etc available, in addition to what is on the mini bar list (so I was told when I asked). They have a kitchen and all the supplies onsite, so I would think they could provide room service and accommodate catering requests if so desired.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, will be back.”
Reviews.Author: fenerbahce2011
Reviews.Content: I am Turkish, and we stayed at Agora Life for 5 days with my English wife and her sister + partner, and we will go back. It is in a fantastic location, in a very quiet side street, and minutes away from St. Sophia, the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, and about a 10 minute walk down the hill (along Ankara Caddesi) to Eminonu, to the ferry terminals. The hotel is very clean, modern, with tiled floors, air conditioning, etc., they change the linen every day, the staff are very friendly, and extremelly helpful. The roof terrace, which is under utilised, has fantastic views of the Bosphorus, the Golden Horn, Topkapi Palace, and St Sophia.

Reviews.Title: “great location plus friendly helpful people”
Reviews.Author: Norbert8
Reviews.Content: We came here after a one night stay in a big modern hotel near Taksim. No comparison frankly. At the Agora Life you get genuine personal service, plus nice touches like a free city map which is explained to you over a cup of tea, free wifi, a little kettle in your room (our posh Taksim hotel had neither free wifi nor kettle). Don't miss the roof terrace with its amazing views and do try the fish restaurant at the end of the street. The famous Cagaloglu Turkish baths are just round the corner - and the hotel's location means you are only about 5 mins walk from Agia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi and the Grand Bazaar - all of which you HAVE to see!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: Happytravler35
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at this hotel when we were visiting Istanbul. The location was perfect - short walking distance from major sites. The hotel was very clean, simply but tastefully decorated with a mellow ambiance. The rooms were in very good shape with nice washrooms, and the beds were comfortable. Breakfast was served daily, buffet style with plenty of variety and a Mediterranean flavor. Free wireless internet was available and the connection was strong. The staff was polite and very friendly, going out of their way to provide good customer service and answer our questions. Kadir gave us some helpful suggestions, and we were never pressured into buying any tours or other tourist-related activities. We were even given thank-you gifts upon checkout. Agora Life is a simple hotel without luxuries such as bars, spas, etc. But if you're looking for a comfortable room, cleanliness, great location, helpful staff and a welcoming atmosphere, you've found the place. Great value in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Exelent hotel super location imazing view !!”
Reviews.Author: ochkinas
Reviews.Content: Dear Travelers, i would like to provide you with some infomation about Agora Hotel. My self and mt wife take 3 days vacation to visit Istambul for 3 days we choose one of the best room Sofia suite has view to all Istabul we saw all day StSofia Church and Bousforus sea veiw it was imazing! We had nice brekfast but esspecso cofe was adaitional charge.. Hotel has very good location in the center Sultanahmet area very very convinient to get any point of interest.. But the best what we find out this is People (staf of hotel) they was Very hospitality and nice explain evthrinthing orginize for us transfer and quick guide for half day!! we had exelent vacaction.... Next time 100% we will stay at the same hotel AGORA THANK YOU and kide warm regards to KADIR and ISA all the best Dmitry and Anastasiya

Reviews.Title: “Well located, exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: magic_curl
Reviews.Content: These guys raise the bar on the already-good standard of Turkish hospitality. Hot tea for us on arrival and accommodating of our unexpected early check-in and miscellaneous requests during our stay. Room was about as expected for its price range. A good spot for exploring the old town in Istanbul - everything here is in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service with brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: SuleimanT
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 days and really enjoyed it. The hotel is perfectly located and within walking distance (5 minutes at most) of all the major attractions and the tram in Sultanahmed (and the buses for the F1GP). It is just tucked of the main street and our room had a nice view of Aya Sofia (a free upgrade :). The service is excellent. As per previous posts by others when you get there they spend 20 minutes taking you through the sites and attractions and how to get there. Everytime you enter and exit the hotel there is someone to greet you with a smile and ask if you need any assistance (It felt as though I was staying with friends) Breakfast was good with a decent variety. I was one of the few that actually requested omelettes (you need to ask for it) and it was really good (try it with tomato and cheese and you will not be disappointed). The one downside was the floors and bathroom were not cleaned thoroughly during the 6 days (but we are fussy). It may have been vacuumed but we saw some dirt that lasted through the 6 days. Noise insulation was good compared to other places but when people spoke in the passage you could hear them in the bedroom. It was one my first stays in a boutique hotel so it was definately a good experience and a definate recommend.

Reviews.Title: “lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: trendySydney
Reviews.Content: Lovely little hotel located close to major attraction sites. It is kept immacuately clean and the staff are friendly. The rooms unfortunately are very small and there is no space to put the suitcase .The sheets and towels provided are very cleen. On three accasions when we stopped there during our travels in Turkey we were given a room facing onother buildings wall. The breakfast was satisfactory but if you wanted a good cup of coffee or fresh orange juice you had to pay extra. When we travelled around Turkey they were kind enougth to look after our excess luggage. l .

Reviews.Title: “Great Days in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: RoseKruger
Reviews.Content: The location was walking distance to blue mosque and all the attractions in sultanahmet. We had a clean spacious affordable room. We had everything we need from a boutique hotel but the staffs made it even more special . The staffs were so personable, warm and helpful, in the end I felt like I was staying at a good friend's house.

Reviews.Title: “Warm welcome, wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Loufinn
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at the Agora Life Hotel with my 11 year-old twin boys and we were all delighted with our stay in every single way. As soon as we arrived, we were welcomed with refreshements in the lobby lounge and asked if we wished to receive some practical information on Istanbul, ie what to see, how to get around etc, which turned out to be extremely helpful. We were accomodated in one of their suites (a complimentary upgrade from a Deluxe room) on the top floor, which was very pretty, comfortable and well-equipped with all the amenities that one could wish for. Our suite had a balcony and an extensive view across the Sea of Marmara and the historic old town, including the beautiful Blue Mosque. Every member of the hotel staff was invariably friendly, competant and clearly eager to help make our experience in Istanbul a good one. Moreover, the hotel is perfectly situated to discover some of the greatest sights and places of interest in the city, as it is within easy walking distance of Aghia Sofia, the Blue Mosque, the Grand Bazaar etc. I would be happy to recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a quiet and comfortable haven in the heart of Sulthanhamet, not to mention excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect fit”
Reviews.Author: ClaudiaFarias
Reviews.Content: If you are traveling with your spouse, this is an excellent place to arrive. We stayed for 3 nights and it was great. The location is excellent, walking distance to main sites and train station that takes you to the best places. Breakfasts is really good, very typical from the region that helps you to know the food culture. The staff was very kind, always very willing to help. When you arrive, you are very welcomed with Turkish tea or beverage of your preference. Beds are good, in my case the bed was not the best, but I was able to sleep well. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My "home" in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: EditorRobyn
Reviews.Content: I love this boutique hotel. I stayed for nearly a month and was very sorry to say goodbye to the wonderful team who really made me feel like the Agora was my home. Nothing was ever too much trouble. The rooms are stylish and comfortable, with great views. The location is ideal. Gulhane Park, a perfect place for morning runs, is just a few minutes' walk away. All the tourist attractions of Sultanahmet are within a block or two, but the hotel is in a neighbourhood that doesn't feel overly touristy. The tram provides quick and easy access to the art gallery and Taksim Square. A nice touch is the library of books available for use of guests. I was working while I was staying, and found the business support (free wireless internet) a great advantage. Also, the breakfast spread is delicious. I've been praising the hotel to my friends on Facebook, and I'm already planning my return. I don't think you could do better in Istanbul in this price range.

Reviews.Title: “Simply perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: Zuzana008
Reviews.Content: Agora Life hotel is simply perfect choice and I would recommend it to everyone, who is looking for good location in the city center. There IÂ´ve got more then expected. It is very pleasant place with friendly atmosphere, which I really appreciate. Friendly and helpful staff, stylish rooms with perfect cleanness and tasty breakfast. I can say only positives!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional value for money”
Reviews.Author: Marilena1414
Reviews.Content: I spent time in Istanbul before, both on business and for holidays, but this hotel offered the best you can get from the city: great room (also with a sea view!), with the most relaxing bed one can imagine, wonderful view from the terrace on top, most friendly and helpful staff. The main tourist attractions are just round the corner, but one is somehow spared the permanent hum and buzz of a busy and big city due to the fortunate location on a quiet alley. Water, tea, coffee and fruit in the room are not just a promise, but a promise kept. I would return any time and recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & top notch service”
Reviews.Author: Skinnersam
Reviews.Content: Easy to tram,located in old Istanbul (Sultanhamet), near to all of Istanbul's must see sites. Staff is very interested in helping make sure you see what you want to see. Also good value for business travelers (free wireless),easy access to tram that will get you to the subway for getting all over Istanbul. Will stay here for next visit...staff won me over :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Great Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Bergen190502
Reviews.Content: Agora Life Hotel is centrally located in old Istanbul (Sultanahmed), small, clean, reasably priced and with a very nice staff. We stayed three nights, and were picked up by the hotel at the airport (which can be smart for a first-time visitor). Most key tourist sites can be easily reached by foot, and Istanbul's excellent public transportation system passes nearby. The veranda on top of the building has a fabulous view of the city and its waterways. Lots of good eating places near by the hotel (we preferred the more local to the more tourist-like). The hotel neighbourhood also feels surprisingly safe being in such a big city. We higly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL STAY”
Reviews.Author: Evelina_Sedova
Reviews.Content: Very nice,helpful and friendly staff. Good location,close to Blue Moscue,Aya Sophia,Bacilica Cistern and Grand Bazaar. A lot of fish and other restaurands around. Clean rooms with all needed stuff.Daily changing of towels.Breakfast is much better and various than in other hotels which i was before in Sultanahmet district. My next visit i'll definately stay in Agora life!

Reviews.Title: “Best choice!”
Reviews.Author: Vgalan
Reviews.Content: One of the most dissent hotel I have stayed in the last years

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Rooms, Great views, fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: wandervivi
Reviews.Content: I'll begin by saying that my husband and I were traveling with our two children aged 2.5 and 6 months. Everyone at Agora Life was so kind and welcoming. They went out of their way to ensure that all of our needs were met. When we'd come home after a long cold day they would bring us tea and hot chocolate for our little girl. They helped us with our bags and served a delicious breakfast every morning. it is often difficult traveling with little ones, but not at agora life. They couldn't have been kinder to our children often taking turns holding our 6 month old so we could eat in the morning. Now, about the views. The hotel is very conveniently located and is an easy walk from the Grand Bazaar, Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque and a ton of great restaurants. Our room had an amazing view of the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi and the Bosphorous. Everything at the hotel was pristine and the bed and shower were perfect. If/when we return to Istanbul, we will no doubt return to Agora Life. We couldn't have hoped for a more wonderful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “AGORA LIFE "SPICED UP" OUR TRIP”
Reviews.Author: alexathenian
Reviews.Content: istanbul is a beautiful colourful city filled with aromas and sights to remember. it is for sure a mixture of both european and eastern elements which is exactly what makes the city unique and worthy of a visit. however, our stay at the lovely agora life hotel was what took off our trip and made our visit memorable. the hotel ideally located near all sights of interest, in a yet quiet street in the sultanahmet area not far from many means of transportation. the personell (and service in general) incredibly polite, professional and calm ,willing to help at all moments. the hotel rooms well decorated and modern. not to mention the fact that they upgraded our room to one of their suites (bosphorus) that happened to be vacant.! i honestly cannot find any flaws to the hotel. the only suggestion i could think of is taking advantage of the wonderful terrace with the amazing views over to ayia sofia and the bosphorus. on the whole, do not think twice about booking with agora life hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay in a modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Catinki
Reviews.Content: Situated on a side-street the Agora Life Hotel is, in the middle of some sight worth seeings, perfect located. It's easy to catch de public transports and to find a restaurant nereby. The hotel staff was welcoming and serviceminded. Our room was comfortable, clean and well equiped. Don't miss the view from the terrace! We'd like to thank you! We've really enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ENRIC-23
Reviews.Content: Nice and quite hotel, well-placed in Sultahmayet near to Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque, Hamam Cagaloglu, Basilica Cistern. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Breakfasts are superior.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, amazing views & super staff!”
Reviews.Author: Helen2930
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an excellent choice for our short trip to Istanbul. It's modern, on a quiet street & the rooms are very clean. The view from the terrace is breathtaking!!! And from our room we had a unique view to the Hagia Sophia! The location is perfect; only a 5 minutes walk away from Hagia Sophia & Blue Mosque. Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazaar and lots of restaurants are also very near. We'd like to thank Kadir and the very helpful, friendly and funny staff! We had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Charming boutique hotel with a personal touch”
Reviews.Author: iguanajo21
Reviews.Content: Traveling alone, I rely heavily on guests reviews before deciding where to stay. I chose this hotel because of the raving reviews on tripadvisor, and I'm glad I stayed here. The hotel was situated in a quiet alley, walking distance to the Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sophia Museum. Rooms were clean with a comfortable bed. There is a wide array of books and magazines in the lounge that you could borrow. Above all, it was the staff that gave this hotel its charm. All staff were courteous, tries their best to accommodate the requests of their guests. Special thanks to Kadir, who took the time to explain how to walk to the main tourists sites As well as arranging tours and airport transfers.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Isola del Gran Sasso d'Italia, Italy
Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: Maria1361
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel in an ideal location for seeing all the sights of this historical city The staff ware extremely helpful, the rooms were cosy and clean, and the location was excellent. I had a very pleasurable experience staying in this hotel. Very clean and warm hotel, staff is very friendly and very helpful a special thanks to Kadir for his great service. Even though it was my first time there, I felt like I've been there before. I would definitely come back again and would recommend this Hotel to my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: Carmel01
Reviews.Content: If cleanliness, location, service, convenience, staff helpfulness, amenities, and value are important for you, this could be your perfect spot as well. I would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Istanbul. It was perfectly located near both the Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque. Aside from travelling to and from the airport, every major attraction was within walking distance. The staff was extremely courteous and helpfulâ€”a special thank to Kadir who helped us to plan out our days providing us with recommendations and directions, and set up transportation for our return to the airport. The quality of service sets this hotel apart from every establishment. If you are at all considering a trip to Turkey, I would recommend Istanbul Agora Life Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute Gem”
Reviews.Author: GulayErener
