Reviews.Content: We stayed at Agora Life Hotel of a total of 2 weeks during our tour I think we couldnâ€™t have made a better choice, certainly worth a stay here. We were looking for a hotel in the Sultanahmet section of Istanbul and found a gem. We found this hotel on the internet and chose it primarily because of its location in the heart of Sultanahmet area within walking distance of the Blue Mosque. I was impressed with the location; itâ€™s in walking distance to all the main historic attractions. Agora Life Hotel and Its staff clearly have as there goal to make your stay in Istanbul as pleasant as possible. They will help you arrange sightseeing tours, Airport transportation, etc. and also will provide you with any help you require Above all would like to thank Kadir who took care of our need and looked after us. We were very sad upon leaving and are sure to stay there again. Overall I would highly recommend the Agora Life Hotel to other travellers, you will not regret.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Escape!”
Reviews.Author: TRACYSAR
Reviews.Content: Perfect location! Perfect View! Super clean! Super helpful and polite staff!

Reviews.Title: “Felt safe as a solo female traveller”
Reviews.Author: Ladymonopoly
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an excellent location. Its close to Hagia Sofia and Blue Mosque and lots of restaurants. I felt very comfortable in the hotel the staff were very friendly. The room was nice the shower was amazing. I felt confortable and safe and if I was to come to Istanbul again I would rebook here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Perl of Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: chrisof
Reviews.Content: The best recommandation for the district of Sultanahmet: newly renovated with an exquisite style, very well situated in the center of the historical Istanbul. Intimate atmostphere. Appropriate location with a breathtaking view over Bosphorus and old city. Grand bazar in 5 mn walking distance. Very friendly and helpful reception personnel. Ideal to spent several days holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Good price-quality, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Best28
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. Its location is perfect for first-time Istanbul visitor; neary all the things to see and also walking distance from Grand Bazaar. The rooms are very clean and staff very friendly. Nothing luxurious, but good value for money. I only expected a bit more from breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “excellent experence”
Reviews.Author: liffen
Reviews.Content: great and convenience location, the staffs are very hospitality, friendly . The rooms are clean n comfortable. We have a group people to stay in . The suite has a great view to see the bridge between old town n new town and golden horn but most impressive was the service that we got from staffs . Let us had a wonderful experience and memory

Reviews.Title: “Suberbly located and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: hasselill
Reviews.Content: Suberbly located hotel. Clean and nice rooms and a very nice and helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Icpeach
Reviews.Content: I stayed this hotel for 2nights and it was amazing. It's really really reasonable considering the room, view from terrace and breakfast. And the staff there was excellent! We just stated 5stars hotel in Dubai night before, but service was sooooo much superior in this hotel. I'll be back next time I stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “It was such a lovely stay,,more than what I expected,,the key term i could use :Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: yiotab
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in an ideal location -at the heart of the historical city... But what made our stay unique was the staff-they really did their outmost...always happy with a smile and true kindness to help us and offer their tips and recommedations.. A big thank you to all of them and especially to Kadir bay...for making our first but not last trip to Instabul so special...

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great view”
Reviews.Author: paulo0882
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best stay I've ever had. It is amazing what you get in this boutique hotel when you compare it to the prices. The rooms and the view are as on the website so I didn't have any disappointment when we arrived to the hotel. Its location is very close to the historical attractions, the rooms are really clean w,th sophisticated decoration and we could sleep very well in the night. there is wireless connection on every level and the terrace has a great view with Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace and the sea. I definately recommend this hotel to whom like to have relaxing vacation.

Reviews.Title: “very satisfactory hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sophie7771
Reviews.Content: The hotel has built the latest facilities. Air-Contioner working well. So I stay warmly in the Winter. The breakfast that the hotel provide is very delicious. Staffes are kind. I'm very very satisfactory with staying this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and comfortable. Great service!”
Reviews.Author: Irenn2011
Reviews.Content: Extremely friendly and helpful staff, coupled with the overall attractiveness and comfort of the hotel (and not forgetting the convenient location) create an excellent impression and willingness to recommend it to friends and collegues. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: MarcioMoreira
Reviews.Content: The hotel is near the most important historic areas of Istambul. The service is excellent and the owner and manager very helpfull and kind. Just to give an example, in our last day at the hotel, was my birthday. They make me a surprise and offer a very good cake! Everybody of the staff singing "happy birthday to you". It was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Good Service”
Reviews.Author: ajjain
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 days in Agora life from 28th December to 1st of Jan. the hotel is in a great location, everything that istanbul has to offer is at your doorstep. Service, cleanliness and the view from the room is amazing as well. Breakfast was good as well. We really had a great time and would highly recommend the hotel to anyone who wants to explore the city or just relax. Thank You

Reviews.Title: “A true reflection of the hospitality Turkey is so famous for worldwide”
Reviews.Author: Cogur
Reviews.Content: I have travelled to Turkey on many occasions and have visited Istanbul numerous times, but for leisure, never. This trip, my wife and I wanted to experience the sites and sounds of Istanbul and wanted to do it in a unique style. Agora Life Hotel, allowed for us to have the true boutique experience we desired, with brilliant proximity to everything Istanbul has to offer historically and entertainment based. With transport practically at your door step, great hospitality by everyone at the hotel, and answers to all queries â€“ no matter how trivial they may be â€“ allow yourself to experience a gem within the wonders of this beautiful city. Definitely recommend it to all!

Reviews.Title: “It is the best hotel which i have ever visited in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: Galina077
Reviews.Content: Agora Life Hotel is located at a historical center of Istanbul, very close to main sights. The hotel's interior is well designed and refined. Everything looks very nice. The hotel staff is very friendly and always ready to help you in any question. Our room was clean, rather big and comfortable. It had everything u could need like water, tea, coffee, kettle, cups, shower things etc. Breakfasts were absolutely delicious! Thank you for such a good mornings) I have been in Istanbul many times and seen many different hotels but Agora Life Hotel is the best one! If i go to Istanbul again, I will stay at Agora for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint vs. Inadequate”
Reviews.Author: DubaiWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews for this hotel before coming here and the high marks coupled with the location made the choice seem like a no brainer. Most reviews described the Agora life as class with an old world charm or spectacular views. Well letâ€™s address class with old world charm. The hotel is in an alley or what appears to be a very small street barely accessible by car. The taxi driver had to walk me there because I could not see it from the corner where he tried to drop me off. It is a nicely renovated building surrounded by other building currently undergoing construction. The staff was friendly and greeted me with kindness. I was upgraded to the deluxe room but coming from Dubai perhaps my expatiation was a little too high. The room was very small and done in a minimalist fashion. My king size bed took up forty percent of the room but it was comfortable. The minimalist style of my room permeated throughout the hotel. Starting with the dry mini bar and ending with everything else. Thatâ€™s correct there was no alcohol in the mini bar but thatâ€™s no problem because you can get a drink at the bar right? Wrong there is no bar and barley a kitchen. They serve one meal which is a complimentary breakfast which I found to be pedestrian at best. Donâ€™t go looking for a late night snack because you wonâ€™t get one. On the upside the location is within 10 minutes walk from all the tourist attractions. If all you need is a bed and you donâ€™t drink or crave night life within a stoneâ€™s throw then this place is for you. The view is nice however Iâ€™m not the type to sit in my little room and stare out the window. This is the most boring place I have ever stayed and it was not inexpensive. For a few more dollars I could have stayed at a five star hotel in Taksim district. This would have placed me near shopping, restaurants, night clubs, and Jazz clubs. I would have been able to get that midnight snack or see another person. The only people I encountered the entire time I was there was the staff. Itâ€™s ok to supply minimal amenities but because everything in this area closes early you need to stock up on whatever your needs may be. It was cold and raining and I was forced to go out because the hotel offers nothing. In conclusion if you donâ€™t want any other human contact in your hotel or you like it very quiet; this place offers a view and close proximity to all the attractions. However for close to the same price you can stay near Taksim in a five star hotel and enjoy some night life and take a trolley or a cab to the tourist attractions without being healed hostage by old world charm with no real amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great 2 Nights in Top Floor Suite”
Reviews.Author: kandb17
Reviews.Content: Hey, not cheap by any means but stellar room with stellar view. Had the Bosphorus room and could not close curtains as view just way too nice. Room great and very comfortable. Staff fantastic. Could not have been more pleased, and what a great location near the all the main sites - easy walk to just about anywhere you could want to see. Breakfast was good, and free wifi great.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: taylordylan20
Reviews.Content: I travel around all around world, and generally I stay in the city hotels which doen not have any spirit. In Agora Life Hotel besides the business I ve a chance to explore the quality of Service and spirit of Istanbul......

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Agora Life Hotel”
Reviews.Author: quito
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Agora Life Hotel in a standard room. It is a new, small 16 room hotel on a quiet street walking distance to many attractions. Rooms are small but well planned with nice molding, and modern bathrooms (shower). Breakfasts were delicious with fresh ingredients and omelets can be made to order. There is a patio on the top floor which has a magnificent view. Staff was helpful. We paid a reasonable rate of 95 Euros per night for 5 nights in August. At this rate or similar I would not hesitate to recommend it. In looking at online rates on several sites , it looks like the rates are all over the place for stays in September and October. I am not sure if this is an error, or there is a main attraction in Istanbul or that the rates have gone up significantly. At a good rate I would not hesitate to recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Elegantly Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: Teddy34
Reviews.Content: This is the one place I would go to if I have the chance to visit Istanbul again. The friendly crew, its cozy atmosphere and its closeness to the center make it a perfect choice. The rooms are really clean, the breakfast is exceptional. Make sure to get the rooms with a total view of Hagia Sophia!

Reviews.Title: “perfect place to stay in instanbul”
Reviews.Author: Evangelos1
Reviews.Content: Very nice and cosy hotel.. Nicely furnished and good service for a fairly reasonable price. Excellent location, service and hospitality make this hotel extra special. Agora Life is just the perfect boutique hotel to stay at in Istanbul and is in the perfect position 10 minutes from the Grand Bazaar and the same down the road to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and the underground cisterns. Thanks Greece thessaloniki

Reviews.Title: “The ultimate icing on the cake!”
Reviews.Author: novick
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for luxury resort hotel in the modern part of the city of Istanbul, one that has a swimming pool and health club and a 4-star restaurant and a massive number of rooms as well as elegant facilities and gift shops, then the Agora Life Hotel is NOT for you! The Agora Life Hotel is a small, personal, and very well located hotel where you immediately feel welcome and at home. Upon arrival, Dafne and her very friendly staff members (including CengÄ±z and â€œMishâ€�), provide information about where to go and what to see and how to get there. They offer you a Turkish cup of tea with â€œlokumâ€� (Turkish delights) and they immediately make you feel like you are staying in their home. This small hotel is new, modern, clean, fresh, and well designed. It is tastefully decorated and is provided with air conditioning and internet. The â€œlobbyâ€� feels like a cosy sitting room. The breakfast is lovely. The location of the hotel is ideal, slightly off the beaten track in the middle of Sultanahmet in a tiny alley (sokak) (where my son could get a soothing shave and play backgammon with the locals) and yet within walking distance of all the major sights, public transportation, and good restaurants (especially the Fish House on the corner). If you can get the room at the top (as we were able to), it is well worth it: the uninterrupted view of the Bosphorus and the Haghia Sofya is breathtaking. What is most impressive about the hotel and the city is the warm hospitality of the Turkish people, especially remarkable in a city of 17 million people! This hotel feels like â€œhome" in a city with a wealthy multicultural and historical heritage. I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a personal, well located, affordable, and comfortable place to stay during their visit to Istanbul. The Agora Life Hotel and its staff members are the ultimate icing on the cake!

Reviews.Title: “The excellent location is trumped only by the superlative hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: adeurl2957
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, service and hospitality make this hotel extra special. Located on a quiet side street in the middle of the key sites (just a few hundred meters from the Palace, mosques and Grand Bazaar) the management and staff made every effort to ensure our stay was enjoyable. The modern, luxurious interior and elegant exterior of this hotel are newly built and full of architectural details. Every convenience was offered, including free access to the internet. The knowledgeable and extremely helpful staff provided much practical information about local sites, restaurants, transportation, etc. We particularly enjoyed the breakfast, which was fresh and extensive â€“ eggs cooked to order, cereals, breads, homemade cakes, real fruit juice, etc, etc. We concluded our 15 week world tour at the Agora Life Hotel and found that its unique combination of location, service and hospitality was unsurpassed.

Reviews.Title: “What a delight!”
Reviews.Author: Jenny052010
Reviews.Content: We had several nights at Agora Life and Defne and her staff made us very welcome. Nothing was too much trouble for the friendly and professional service. From the magnificient views from our room although lacking is size perhaps it made up in the luxurious furnishings from the comfort of the bed and furnishings to the products in the bathroom and the welcolme basket of fruit & the complimentary water which is replaced daily. Next time we will stay longer. Many thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: tibetVictorHarbor
Reviews.Content: Agora Life is just the perfect boutique hotel to stay at in Istanbul - it's new, spotlessly clean, Dephne and the staff are really friendly and helpful, and is in the perfect position 10 minutes from the Grand Bazaar (around which are some fantastic ethnic restaurants which even cater for a vegetarian beautifully!) and the same down the road to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and the underground cisterns. The breakfasts are sensational and a great start to the day. Thanks for having us Dephne. Peter and Sue Bauer, South Australia

Reviews.Title: “Cosy and nicely decorated, Ideally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: emmamelie
Reviews.Content: Very nice and cosy hotel. 5 mn away from Blue Mosquee and St Sophia. Nicely furnished and good service for a fairly reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is just extremely well situated and the quality of service and the rooms are excellent.”
Reviews.Author: Honza1977
Reviews.Content: This is the third time that I went to Istanbul. I have never enjoyed my trip before that much. The city itself is one of the most beautiful cities around the world but I have been especially nicely surprised by the service and the good quality of rooms in this hotel. I certainly advise everybody to enjoy a drink on the georgeous roof with a magnificient Istanbul view.

HotelInfo.Name: Agora Life Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Cagaloglu Hamam Sokak No:6 | Old City, Sultanahmet, Istanbul 34110, Turkey
